Patient Particulars: Name: Sarah; Sex: Female; Marital status: Married
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Restlessness
2. Excessive worry
3. Difficulty concentrating
4. Irritability
5. Decreased sleep (Initiation)
History: Present history: Patient resumed her studies after 20 years. She has been feeling restless and worrying about her life both at home and work as she is unable to manage. She has started thinking a lot about her grandmother. During patient's school years, she used to take care of her and used to encourage her. Patient lost her when she was very young and was deeply affected by it. She now feels guilty that her lack of management will make her grandmother upset ; Substance use history: She consumes alcohol and marijuana a couple of times in a week.
Current Mental Status Examination: Behavior: Patient was cooperative and rapport could be established; Mood: Anxious; Affect: Restricted; Thought: Content- Preoccupation with feelings of guilt
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient described her feelings of worry where that she is unable to manage her home and studies after taking a 20 year gap. She feels as if she is upsetting her grandmother's memories this way. She has been sleeping less due to these thoughts and so feels irritable most of the time. She finds it troublesome to concentrate and feels restless all the time.
